name: 3dGrayplot
author: AFNI Team
description: Make a grayplot from a 3D+time dataset, like a carpet plot. Result is saved to a PNG image.

inputs.description: Name of mask dataset. Voxels that are 0 in the mask will not be processed.
inputs.name: Mask dataset

inputs.description: Name for the output file. Default is Grayplot.png
inputs.name: Output file

inputs.description: Output size of image in pixels: [width height]. Defaults are width=1024 and height=512.
inputs.name: Output dimensions

inputs.description: Original resampling method for processed dataset.
inputs.name: Old resampling method

inputs.description: Order of polynomials for detrending. Default is 2. Use '-1' if data is already detrended and de-meaned.
inputs.name: Polynomial order

inputs.description: FWHM of blurring radius to use in the dataset before making the image. Default is 0 mm.
inputs.name: Blurring FWHM

inputs.description: Order the voxels by how well they match the two leading principal components of their partition.
inputs.name: PV order

inputs.description: Order the voxels by their Ljung-Box statistics, a measure of temporal correlation.
inputs.name: LJ order

inputs.description: Order the voxels by how many 'peel' steps are needed to get from the partition boundary to the voxel.
inputs.name: Peel order

inputs.description: Default intra-partition ordering by dataset 3D index ('ijk').
inputs.name: IJK order

inputs.description: Set the range of the data to be plotted. Value of 0 is middle-gray, +X is white, -X is black.
inputs.name: Data range

inputs.description: Scale values to percent differences from the mean of each voxel timeseries. Suitable for raw time series datasets.
inputs.name: Percent scaling

inputs.description: Map values <= A to black, values >= B to white, and intermediate values to grays.
inputs.name: Raw with bounds
